sense.name: a shallow gully
sense.examples: Rainwater had collected in the draw beside the road. We crossed several arid draws in the desert.

sense.name: a celebrity or entertainer who attracts a large audience
sense.examples: The main draw at the event will be the senator from New York. The singer is a big draw in Las Vegas.

sense.name: a game that ends in a tie
sense.examples: The chess game ended in a draw. There can't be a draw in that game, you play until somebody wins.

sense.name: the act of random selection among a set of things
sense.examples: The names of the contestants will be chosen by a random draw. It was just the luck of the draw. (what was randomly chosen)

sense.name: playing cards you are dealt, a hand
sense.examples: John didn't like his draw, with not even one pair. THe dealer shuffled the cards before everyone got their draw.

sense.name: a golf shot that hooks to the side unintentionally
sense.examples: The golf instructor showed Tom how to swing his club to avoid a draw.

sense.name: a feint in a football pass
sense.examples: The quarterback's draw fooled the offense. The draw to the fullback was complete.

sense.name: a type of poker where replacement cards are drawn from the deck
sense.examples: We decided to play five-card draw. During seven-card draw, Mary drew three aces.

sense.name: the act of hauling an object
sense.examples: The child wanted a draw up the hill on his sled. Their draw of the body into the yard left bloody tracks along the floor.

sense.name: the act of ingesting into the body
sense.examples: Bob took a long draw off his cigarette. The thirsty man took a draw from John's water bottle.

sense.name: pulling something out from a container
sense.examples: The gunfighter is known throughout the west for his fast draw. The argument escalated into the draw of weapons. The magician's draw of a rabbit from his hat delighted the audience. They need a second draw of blood from the patient.
